content: *this clever tea cozy uses stranded colorwork in an unusual way by intentionally pulling the alternate shade too tight you create pleats top off any one of the three suggested shade combinations with a fun pom-pom patons yarns * materials sizes 2 cup 4/6 cup-6/8 cup patons® classic wool 100 g/3 5 oz 192 m/210 yds *2 colors 1 ball each for all sizes* contrast a 77222 cloverleaf contrast b 77605 pumpkin or contrast a 77219 seafoam contrast b 77435 water chestnut or contrast a 00226 black contrast b 00201 winter white size 4 5 mm u s 7 knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge make two pieces alike sew side and top seams leaving openings for handle and spout sew pom-pom to top of tea cozy to finish pom-pom diagram is included in pdf download december 2011 french version november 2011 couvre théière classique à pli au tricot 1 > *patons #115 bazaar novelties and gifts by beehive* pg 7 > > *description the classic tea cosy garter stitch knit with two > alternating balls of yarn using the > carried yarn to created a pleated > effect for extra insulation knit in > two halves then sewn together to > accommodate the tea-pot s handle and > spout *ed note the original vintage pattern calls for either patons canadiana superwash wool or canadiana sayelle neither are available any longer but any washable yarn in a worsted-to-bulky range should work * 1 http //www patonsyarns com/data/pattern/pdf/patons_classicwoolweb11_kn_teacozy fr_ca pdf
